docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: create new repo from frontend
docs.text:
Login into your github account then head to

New Repository

docs.title: push repo using ssh
docs.text:
git remote add origin git@github.com:SirECMG/elton-blog.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main

docs.title: create post
docs.text: This is my first blog post using mkdocs-material..

docs.title: give it a metadata
docs.text:
date: is a mandatory header

---
  date: yyyy-mm-dd
---

additional metadata to improve experience

docs.title: references
docs.text: original guide to create post using mkdocs-material

docs.title: git add --patch
docs.text:
This command allows you to concisely add lines of code to a commit.

git add --patch

docs.title: select lines of code
docs.text:
You will then select lines of code that matter to the commit. Each sections of code shown is a hunk.

  • select 'y' to agree to add hunk
  • select 'n' to ignore hunk

docs.title: edit hunks
docs.text: If there is a line of code that does not fit in the hunk. You have to select 'e' to edit the hunk. Remove lines of code that don't matter by deleting it.

docs.title: git squash tutorial
docs.text:
1. checkout feature branch
git checkout bug_fix
  1. act and operate on previous 3 commits from head
git rebase -i HEAD~3
  1. change the commits you want to collidate to "squash" instead of "pick"
  2. "squash" means consolidate to the previous "pick" commit
  3. next you will need to edit the commit message of the squashed commit. this will be the updated commit message
